page.title: 08HELSTON MUSEUM
page.content: The Helston Museum was formerly a butter and meat market(1837). The Museum was opened in{1949}and the first curator was{William.F. {Dolton (1946-70). } The curator is now{Mr Martin {Matthews.}When it was a butter and meat market farmers wives used to come in to sell their produce. After the war many people wished to get rid of everyday objects that were around the house. Mr Dolton asked them if he could display them in his pub"The Bee Hive," instead of throwing them away. Soon he found that he needed more room to display the objects and as the butter and meat market was not then in use it proved to be an ideal place. It is now owned by Kerrier Council. Its most prized possessions are a dinner service made in china clay from Tregonning Hill.
